Fields.DialogueText: I see we're still matching, Capitano.
Hmmm? Oh, you mean the Corona Navalis necklace?
Yeah, I'm just happy to see you're still wearing it.

Fields.MenuText: Of course. I'm never taking it off.
Are you still wearing yours?
I actually hate this thing. I only put it on when I see you coming.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? You're not joking, right? Because I feel the same way.
Of course. Why wouldn't I be wearing it? Did you think I traded it away already or something?
You're joking, right? How would you always see me coming? Unless... you're already keeping an eye on me anyway...
To be honest, I am a little surprised. I figured you'd be clamoring for some new art, right about now.
Well, now that you mention it... I do like matching with you, Capitano, but it has been a while since I've gotten any new art.
I hear you. You wanted me to get you something new to trade with, right?
So you do remember?
How could I forget? Don't worry, I'll get you something soon.
I can't wait, Capitano. I'm sure it'll be great!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Cesare, do you have a moment? I've got some questions for you.
Are you looking for some art tips? I'm not sure I should help you. I'm interested to see what you'll get me on your own.
I'll keep that in mind, but I actually had something else I wanted to talk to you about.
Oh, well, go ahead, Capitano. I'm all yours.
Well, after our successful mission in the U.S. we're being given our choice of assignment. I remember you saying you wanted to travel more. Now's your chance.
What do you mean?
I mean, we can pick our next assignment based on location. If you'd like.
Oh, I see! We can go somewhere I've always wanted to go, and just ignore the mission!

Fields.MenuText: Well, no. We'd still have to do the mission.
Exactly. Let's be lazy.
You'd want to ignore the mission? That doesn't exactly sound like you.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. I was about to be very upset with you, Capitano.
What are you thinking, Capitano? We can't just ignore the Morganas!
It's not like me. Ignoring our mission would be really inappropriate.
Wherever we go, we need to make sure we actually do the mission.
Okay, agreed. But where exactly would you like to go?
*ALARM*
Well, right now, it sounds like we're going to battle.
Why is it so hard to get an answer out of her sometimes?
@BATTLE
Hmmmm...
Cesare? Have you come up with an answer?
I'm thinking.
You've been thinking for a while now. If we don't pick an assignment soon, they'll just pick one for us.
Hmph, fine. Then let's go to... somewhere in Asia!
Asia's a big place.
And I've never been. I've heard great things, though! Maybe Korea? Or Japan even?! I've always wanted to see Japan.

Fields.MenuText: It's a lovely place.
From what I've heard, Japan is a pretty great vacation destination.
Eh, I'm not looking forward to this. I hate sushi.

Fields.DialogueText: You've been? You're so lucky! You'll have to show me all the sights! I mean... from the ship, of course.
Right? Do you think we'll meet a samurai?
You hate sushi? Would you like it better if I cooked it for you? But then I guess it really wouldn't be sushi, would it?
All right, I'll see if I can get us an assignment in Japan.
Or Korea if there's nothing in Japan!
I'll remember.
You better! I'm really looking forward to this trip now.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Good news, Cesare. I've got our new mission.
Already? If it's good news, then it better be in Japan. Or Korea.
It's in Japan.
Really? I thought for sure you wouldn't be able to get anything good.
Do you really have so little faith in me?
No. I mean yes? I'm not really all that sure. The only thing I definitely have faith in is God Almighty.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that hurts.
Eh, there's no competing with God.
I guess God might've helped get us this mission.

Fields.DialogueText: Why? Were you really comparing yourself to God? Haven't you heard the story about Icarus?
Exactly. But you're pretty good too.
He does work in mysterious ways.
You know what this means, don't you?
No? Should I?
It's time for you to go shopping. I can't go all the way to Japan without something to trade.
All right, all right, I hear you.
Of course you do. I'm standing right here. You shouldn't be, though. You should be shopping.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What... is this? A mask? Ewww...
It's your new art. Something for you to trade with in Japan.
This... Oh! You... You bought this yourself? I, uh, I don't know what to say.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to say anything.
A thank you is good enough for me.
If you don't like it, I can always get you something else.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think I could say anything. Even if I was pressed. Which is a first for me.
Well, yes, thank you! I'm very happy that you got this for me. Why you got this instead of... anything else... I'm not sure, but I'm still thankful.
What makes you think I don't like it? I'm smiling, right? I was doing my best to force a smile. Was it not coming through?
You hate it, don't you?
That... doesn't matter. I won't have it for long anyway, right? I can just trade it as soon as we get to Japan.
I know it's a little scary-looking, but I thought you might like its history. I was told it was an ancient war mask.
Hmmm, that is actually interesting. It makes it slightly more bearable to look at. But only slightly.
It is pretty ugly, isn't it?
It sure is. I usually like my art to be a little more aesthetically pleasing, but I do like items with an interesting story. Maybe you know what I like better than I thought.
I was right! You do hate it!
No, I did hate it. I think I'm actually warming up to it now. Good job, Capitano.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I'm sensing a group of Morganas approaching us.
More Morganas? Are you sure?
Do you really think I'd be coming to the capitano if I wasn't?
Of course you wouldn't, Cesare. You get in position, and you go sound the alarm. We've got another fight on our hands.
Yes, Captain. You can count on us!
Where do you want me, Capitano?
By my side. We'll win this battle together.
@BATTLE
That was impressive, Capitano. You have a real talent for leading the crew.
It's not really a talent. It took a lot of practice to develop the skill.
That's not a talent? Isn't a talent just something you're good at?
Not... quite? Do you really not understand what a talent is?
Well... I'm pretty sure I've never had one.
What?
My sister always used to tell me that my talent was "TBD". Never really knew what that meant.

Fields.MenuText: That's harsh. Especially from your sister.
Yeah... uh, no idea what that means, either. You'll have to ask her some day.
I'm sure she was joking.

Fields.DialogueText: Harsh? Why is it harsh? What's "TBD"?
I'd ask her and she'd just laugh at me. It was always so annoying how she'd take joy in avoiding my questions.
My sister's not much of a joker. At least... If she is, I never understood any of her jokes.
I don't think I'll ever have a talent. Are there just untalented people out there?
I guess, but you're not one of them, Cesare.
How can you be so sure?
Because I know you. And I have faith that you'll figure out what your talent is one day. Hopefully with my help.
If you really believe I have a talent to be found, I'd welcome your assistance. Thank you, Capitano.
Good! I feel the same way...
So if it's not something that you're good at, then what is a talent?
Well, you're close. It's something you're good at without really trying.
Without trying? So... like breathing? I never even try to breathe, but I'm always doing it. Is that a talent?

Fields.MenuText: Yup.
Not quite. That's just a natural biological function.
You breathe? I wasn't actually sure if Belles had to.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?! I have a talent!? Wait... this seems too easy. Doesn't that mean that every living thing has the same talent?
So a talent has to be something unnatural? Got it. Go on.
Well... I don't know if I have to, but I do. Without even thinking. Maybe I should see if I can go without breathing some time...
Okay, you're not quite getting it. Maybe an example would help.
A while ago I knew this guy who could drink anyone under the table. It was like alcohol didn't affect him. That's a talent.
Being able to drink a lot?
Yeah. It wasn't something he practiced. It was just this natural affinity he had. An inability to get drunk. He ended up making a hobby of outdrinking every new recruit their first night.
People with talents have hobbies? Okay... and drinking is a talent?
Are you taking notes?
How else am I supposed to learn my talent?
You're adorable, but you're still not getting it...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, Cesare, today we're going to figure out what your talent is.
Today? Right now? That's a whole lot of pressure. What if we don't figure it out? Are you going to be disappointed in me?
Don't overthink it, okay? Let's just start with something easy. What kinds of things have you done?
What do you mean? Are we talking about breathing again?
No, I just mean in your life. What have you tried doing? You find out what you're good at by doing things.
Oh... well, I mean I've done a lot of things. I've been a flagship! I was actually a really good flagship. Is that a talent?
Maybe. Just keep going. What else have you done?
Well, I was a teacher for a short time. I was made an officer in the Carabinieri. Oh, and I did a little modeling for photographs.

Fields.MenuText: A teacher? What did you teach?
You were in the Carabinieri? I'm having trouble picturing you in the military police force.
You modeled? I hope they were tasteful photographs.

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly? No idea. I'm still not even sure why they made me do it. I just stood in front of a chalkboard and talked. I gave everyone an A though, so I guess they learned.
Well, it was an honorary rank. I doubt I would have lasted long for real. They said I asked too many questions.
Of course they were tasteful, Capitano. I'm told I looked so lovely leaving port that people just had to take photographs. And that was before I was a Belle. Imagine all the photos they'd take now!
Okay, so we know what you've already tried. That's a good starting off point.
Great, I'm glad I could help... How did I help?
Well, would you say you had a natural talent for any of those things?
Not... really?
Well, then we know what you're not talented at. Which is better than not knowing anything.
I guess, but I'd really rather know what I am talented at.
Baby steps, Cesare.
I can imagine...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, I need your honest opinion on something.
I wouldn't give you anything else. What's going on?
Well, you said my talent was probably something I haven't tried yet. So look at this! I think I might be a painter!
Uh, I think you might've spilled some paint on your art though.
Huh? Oh, no, this is what it's supposed to look like.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, in that case, it's lovely.
Were you trying to paint a green puddle?
It's horrible. Sorry, but I can't lie to you.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I mean, I was pretty sure I... wait, why does your face look like that? You look like you swallowed a handful of nails.
No, this is what I imagine Japan's going to be like!
I was afraid you'd say that...
I'm not a painter, am I?
I'm afraid not.
Well, back to the drawing board.
I'd probably skip the drawing board if I were you. I'm afraid it'd come out like your painting.
Are you making a joke? It's not very funny.
Cheer up. We're almost to Japan. You've got to be looking forward to that, right?
Oh, right! I'm finally going to be in Japan! I've been so busy with this that I haven't even planned what I wanted to do when we finally got there.
Well, you still have some time, Cesare. Get on it while you can.
Right. Finding my talent can wait for a little bit.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
So, Capitano, we're almost in Japan. Do you know what you want to do when we get there?

Fields.MenuText: Probably hunt down some Morganas.
Get some food, definitely. I'm craving sushi.
I'd like to see the sights if I have time.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, obviously we're going to do that, Capitano. But what about in your free time?
Some classic Japanese food does sound like a good way to kick off our arrival.
Sightseeing is a very important part of this trip, for sure. There's so much I want to see too.
Cesare, we're here for you. Why are you so concerned with what I want to spend my time doing?
Well, because as much as I want to see Japan, I'd rather see it together with you. You don't want to go without me, do you?
Well, no. I definitely think I'd prefer the company.
Exactly! It can't be any fun being in a foreign land by yourself. Not that I would know, really.
Anyway, I was thinking we'd start everything off with some shopping. I've been having the urge to trade since we started this trip. I can't wait to see what beautiful art I can get.
You're that eager to get rid of that ugly mask I got you?
No, actually, I warmed up to it a bit. Still have to turn it toward the wall at night, but other than that, I like it. You know, I just don't keep my art for that long.
Yeah, I know. I'm still surprised that you haven't traded away that necklace.
My Corona Navalis? Never. Not as long as we match.
Never it is then. Now, tell me. What's next on this itinerary you've cooked up for us?
Oh, I've got so much planned! You think you have enough time to hear it all now?
Let's find out.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What is this? You really expect me to trade with this piece of garbage?
Hey, it's not garbage. I'll admit I wasn't a fan of it at first, but it's actually a really interesting piece of art.
You really believe that, don't you? Where did you even get this thing? I know I didn't pick it up for you.
The Capitano actually picked it up for me before we left for Japan.
Oh. Well, that explains it a little bit.
What is that supposed to mean?
Well, it's obvious enough that you have a little thing for him, Cesare. Why else would you be holding on to that necklace of yours?
I - I don't - What are you... You don't know anything!
Oh, did I just walk into a fight?
Capitano!? How long have you been there?

Fields.MenuText: Not long. I just got here.
I was actually listening at the door for a while. I like to be sneaky like that.
Long enough to hear you shouting. What's going on?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, good. So you didn't hear anything, right? Nothing embarrassing?
What? Really? You spy around the ship like that? I'm going to have to watch what I say from now on.
I wasn't shouting. This is a perfectly reasonable volume to be having a conversation, isn't it?
Don't worry, Capitano. She'll calm down after I get her something new to play with. If I can get anyone to trade for this hideous thing.
Yeah, it's not the prettiest thing in the world, but I think Cesare liked it.
Oh, I'm sure she absolutely loved it.
Shut up and go get me something new from port!
Heh, of course. At once, Cesare.
Are you okay?
Yeah. He was just getting on my nerves. You shouldn't listen to anything he says. I think he might be a compulsive liar.
Um... okay?
Great! I, uh, I've got some work to do, so I'll see you later, Capitano.
That was... weird, right?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, look, isn't this kimono beautiful? That officer may, um, be a compulsive liar - that you should never ever trust or listen to - but boy, does he know how to shop!
A kimono? You'll look lovely in that! I'm surprised he was able to get something like that for that ugly mask I got you.
Now you're calling it ugly too? If it really was as ugly as you say, then how could I have gotten this gorgeous outfit in exchange for it?

Fields.MenuText: Well, he's a compulsive liar, right? Maybe he actually just bought that with money.
Maybe it's actually an ugly kimono, but you'll make it look really good.
You make an excellent point. It's no use arguing with you.

Fields.DialogueText: He's not a com- Oh, right, I mean... yeah, maybe!
Oh, Capitano, are you trying to flatter me? I feel flattered. Are my cheeks red? I think I'm starting to feel flushed.
You're just giving up like that? I feel like that was too easy. You shouldn't just let me win, Capitano. If that's what you're doing, I mean.
You do think I look pretty, though, right?
I think you look absolutely breathtaking, no matter what you've got on.
In a good way? Not in the "I can't breathe, you're killing me" way, right?
Yes, in a good way.
Fantastic. I'm glad you like it. Now, if I can just figure out how to get it on...
Um...
I think I just tie it, but it won't fit over my uniform. Maybe if I take my uniform off first, we'll have an easier time. First, I pull this part-
Um! Sorry, Cesare, but maybe I can't help you with it. Maybe you should do that in your cabin. Or maybe I'll just leave my office.
Oops! Oh, did I just... Did I embarrass you? Or maybe I embarrassed myself? Your cheeks are red. Are my cheeks red, too? Is it hot in Japan, or just in here?
Your cheeks are, um-
*ALARM*
We should probably deal with that, I think...
@BATTLE
Capitano, I never even asked, did I?
Asked what?
What our mission was. I was just so excited to be traveling all this way, I didn't even stop to ask why. That's new for me.
You're right. There's usually never a question you don't ask.
Exactly. So I'm asking now. Why are we here?
Well, we're just here to patrol. Apparently something's going on nearby that's taking a lot of attention away from the area. We're here to fill the holes.
Hmmmm... doesn't that seem like a waste of our skills? Shouldn't we be helping with whatever's going on nearby?

Fields.MenuText: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.
Well, if we did that, we wouldn't be in Japan like you wanted.
Even the smaller, less glamorous jobs are important, Cesare.

Fields.DialogueText: We have a horse? No, wait, that's a saying, right? I've heard that before. But what is a gift horse? I've never seen a horse with a bow on it. I don't think they'd like that, would they?
That's a good point. I am enjoying the sightseeing.
Of course they are. Someone does need to protect the ports. And we have been fighting a lot of Morganas here. Yeah, I think we're needed here, right?
*ALARM*
Well, what do you know? It's our reason for being here.
Morganas. I guess it really is a good thing we're here.
We can't let these monsters do whatever they like.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I've made an unfortunate discovery.
And what would that be?
I don't possess a talent for sewing, dancing, or wearing a kimono...

Fields.MenuText: I think I can connect the dots.
What exactly happened, Cesare?
You know what? I don't think I even want to know the details.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have any questions? That seems weird to me.
It's a little embarrassing. Can we just say my kimono... broke?
Good, because the details are my least favorite part.
Okay, now I think you just have to explain everything.
Do I really have to?
Yes. No excuses.
Okay... I was trying on my new kimono before I traded it for something new, and I looked so pretty that I just start spinning around and... I guess it snagged on something and ripped.
And then you tried to sew it back together?
My fingers hurt.
Yeah, sewing is pretty hard.
I think I just don't have a talent. My sister was right.
Hey, she said your talent was "TBD," right? That stands for "To Be Determined".
Oh, that's what that stands for? Right now I feel like it might stand for Totally Brain Dead.
No, I don't think your sister would say something like that. She didn't mean that you had no talent, she just meant you haven't discovered it yet.
You really think so? I just need to find some hidden skill?
I'm sure of it, Cesare. And we'll find it. It just might take a little while. It's going to be a process of elimination.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Let's do some elimination on these Morganas!
Heh. Process of elimination. Let's call it a process.
What did I say?
Hey... Capitano... you... called me?
Cesare? Why are you out of breath?
I was seeing if I was... I'm not a runner. I don't... think I'm really athletic... at all.
Well, at least now you know.
I'm also not good at singing, I can't cook, and apparently I ask too many questions to be a good listener.

Fields.MenuText: You tried singing? And you didn't invite me to listen?
I would've thought you'd have learned a thing or two from our cooks.
Well, I could've told you that last one.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't let anyone listen, but people were banging on my door telling me to stop. Maybe I shouldn't have done it in the middle of the night.
I tried to, but the best I could do was mediocre. I think our cooks just might be magical.
Well, why would anyone tell you their problems if they didn't want you to ask questions and try to fix it? It doesn't make sense to me.
I still have more ideas, though, so I'm not giving up just yet.
Well, that's the important part.
So did you need me for something?
Yeah, you received another letter from Cavour.
About time! You didn't read it, did you?
Of course not. Should I have?
Definitely not!
*ALARM*
Dang it, I'm still exhausted from all the running. And I really wanted to read this.
You'll be able to read it after we deal with these Morganas. Come on!
@BATTLE
So what did Cavour have to say this time?
I just asked her for a little advice. I've been having a problem on board that I just don't quite know how to solve.
You mean your talent?
Oh, no, actually. There's... somebody on the ship that I'm... Well, we're not as close as I'd like us to be.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, you have a crush on someone?
Smart. As the spirit of the ship, you should be close with everyone on board.
There's someone in the crew that doesn't like you? I find that hard to believe. Point them out to me. I'll set them straight!

Fields.DialogueText: What? No! No, what would make you think that?! I just want to be close with every member of the crew. That's all!
That's... exactly it! You're so smart to know that that's what I was thinking. Good job, Capitano!
Oh, no, there's no need for that, Capitano. It's such a large crew that you probably wouldn't know them anyway. So just don't try to bring this up with anyone, okay!?
Okay, okay, you don't have to shout. So what was her advice?
Her what?
What was Cavour's advice to help you get closer with this shipmate?
Oh, well, her original advice didn't really work, so now she's just telling me to be direct about it. Which is a little out of character for her.
I think she might just be tired of talking with me about this subject. I have a way of pressing her buttons and making her lose her calm. Hey, is that a talent?
I'm pretty sure that's just a sibling thing.
Oh, shoot. So what do you think? Should I just be direct like Cavour says?
I think it's worth a shot. I've heard worse ideas.
Really? Well... in that case, I-
*ALARM*
Looks like we've got Morganas.
Really? Now?
I agree. It's horrible how they always appear at the worst moments. Like, I was about to get something to eat. Let's teach them a lesson.
@BATTLE
Capitano, do you have a second to talk?
Sure. As long as you're not about to impugn my taste in art again.
Don't get me started, Capitano. I'm actually asking about Cesare.
What about her?
Well, I mean... isn't it obvious? She's clearly fond of you. And I think it extends well past platonic affection.

Fields.MenuText: You're crazy. You think she has feelings for me?
So I'm not crazy? She really does like me?
That's a big word. I might need you to explain things to me like I'm a toddler.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think, I know. I've got a sixth sense about these things.
Obviously. You'd have to be blind not to see it.
Seriously? Okay... She loves you. Idiot. Was that more clear?
She was actually defending that hideous mask you got her. You don't do something like that unless there's romance involved.
The mask wasn't that bad!
Look, I'm not here to argue about your taste. I just need to know whether you're about to break her heart or not. I'd like a heads up.
What?
Well, in my experience, most women like to drown their sorrows with shopping. So I'd like to get ready if you're going to reject her.
I'm not going to reject her.
Oh! Really? Well, you'd better put a ring on that finger, Capitano. Actions speak louder and all that.
A ring?
Oh, I'm not being literal, Captain. I just mean if you're going to confess to her or something, that you'd probably want to do it with some romantic gift.
Hmmm... That doesn't sound like a bad idea. But how do I find something she wouldn't want to trade away in a few weeks?
That's the hard part. If you have such strong feelings, though, it should be easy. Good luck, Capitano.
Why do I get the sense that that guy just likes stirring up trouble?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, I finally found a little time off the ship. Let's see if I can't find something for Cesare.
What am I supposed to get? I could just tell her how I feel without some sort of gift... That should be fine too, right?
Damn, I think that guy is getting in my head.
Hello there! What are you looking for this fine evening?
Oh, uh, actually, I'm not quite sure I really know what I'm looking for.
I see. Well, let's start with a simple question. Who are you buying for? Yourself? A friend? Someone special?

Fields.MenuText: Someone... very special. She has very particular tastes.
A friend. Maybe more? Honestly, I'm really not sure right now.
Myself. Just shopping for souvenirs.

Fields.DialogueText: A special girl with special tastes. I can understand your predicament.
Ah, love. I've heard the story far too many times. Trust me, I can assist you.
Then you've come to the right place. Let's get you something so you'll never forget your time here.
Let's see if I've got any special items that could be just what you're looking for. Follow me.
A good friend of mine, another merchant, was going through some money trouble, so I've just recently got my hands on a plethora of goods that you can peruse. Here.
Is that a stuffed yak covered in jewels?
My friend had very interesting tastes. The room is a bit of a mess, but we've got art pieces, jewelry, furniture, all for you to choose from. Take your time.
Where's the... jewelry?
All over, honestly, but the majority of it is hanging from the jeweled yak's horns.
Oh, right, of course. Where else would it be?
I don't know... I just can't find anything... perfect.
Well, there's your problem. You shouldn't be looking for something perfect. You should be looking for something that calls to you.
Finding that mask was hard enough... This is going to take forever.
But you will find something. Take my word for it.
I'll be back. I just need to think about it some more.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Cesare, the time for fun and games is over. We have to change our course.
What's going on?
Remember that situation nearby? The reason they needed us to patrol the area?
Is it getting worse? Do they need us to come in and save the day?
Well, actually, yeah. I don't know the details, but they're calling for aid, and we're the closest.
Nothing could make this trip better. Let's ride in and defeat whatever horrible monster is causing trouble this time!

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised you're so eager to leave. I thought you were enjoying Japan.
Sounds good to me. Let's hurry.
You don't want to do a little more sightseeing?

Fields.DialogueText: I am, but I don't need to stay forever. I can just remember it. Kind of like art.
Glad we're on the same page. We have no time to waste.
Sightseeing? You just told me we're needed to fight a super dangerous Morgana, and you're concerned with sightseeing? You need to get your priorities straight, Capitano.
Say goodbye to Japan for now, Capitano. We can always come back after we save the day.
As long as we survive.
Of course we'll survive. We always survive. Why wouldn't we survive?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Do you know what we're fighting, Capitano?
Probably Morganas.
Well, obviously. But what about the details? How many? How big? How dangerous?

Fields.MenuText: Your guess is as good as mine.
They're the worst of the worst. Whatever you're imagining, multiply it by a million.
I couldn't care less about the details.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm... then I'm going to guess a lot. And they're probably really big, right? And dangerous. Wait, should I be guessing that they're weak? Would that affect the outcome?
A million? I'm not even sure I can do that math... Give me a minute.
But Cavour always said that knowledge was power. So wouldn't that mean that the more details we know, the more power we have? My sister's usually right about this stuff.
We're pretty much going into this fight knowing nothing. For some reason, we're not getting any more communications from the ships out there.
That's not a good sign. Maybe they're all dead? Or maybe they were teleported to an alternate dimension.
Your imagination is getting away from you again. They're probably just busy fighting the Morganas.
I hope so. Because the alternative explanation could be vampires.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Vampires?!
They should be... right there.
You mean in that giant storm?
Exactly. I think we know why they weren't able to communicate.
So not vampires?
No. The storm is probably messing with their equipment.
If they're still alive in there.

Fields.MenuText: Don't even joke about that.
That is something we should be wary of. We could be walking into an ambush.
You're not talking about vampires again, are you?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not joking. If the Morganas defeated them, this could be a trap.
Let's hope they're still alive in there. Or that they at least hurt the Morganas enough for us to finish them off.
I wasn't. But now that you mention it, we might want to grab some garlic. I mean, just in case.
Well, we're not doing anyone any good out here. Let's head in.
You're sure this is a good idea, right?
No, but I really do think that we can handle whatever is waiting for us in there.
Okay, then I do too. Let's go!
@BATTLE
That's the Morgana we're dealing with?! It's huge!
And it's not the only one. Now that we're in here, I can sense more of these things.
All the same size?
More or less.
*BOOM*
What was that? Are you all right, Cesare?
I'm fine. A Morgana was the one who took the hit.

Fields.MenuText: Are they turning on each other?
So our allies are still alive in here?
Was it spontaneous combustion?

Fields.DialogueText: Is that a possibility? Could we have secret allies among the Morganas?
Either that or they're undead. But either way, they still seem to be on our side.
Is that really a thing? Should I start carrying a bucket of water with me?
*BOOM*
It's taking more hits.
And I think it's noticed us, too. We might want to start firing before it gets a chance.
Good call. Let's take these guys out.
@BATTLE
So. They weren't vampires.
I didn't think so. Vampires aren't real. Right?
No, as far as I know. They were thankful that we came to help them finish the last of those Morganas off.
Isn't it weird that the storm stopped just as we defeated the last Morgana? Could they have been causing it? There's so much we don't know about these things.
And you're getting caught in your own thoughts again.
That's what you think, Capitano. Don't worry. I can focus on you and all my questions at the same time.
Really? You have a lot of questions.
I also have a lot of love for you, Capitano.
What?
I... I'm being direct, Capitano. I have feelings for you.

Fields.MenuText: This is unlike you, Cesare.
I... I can't believe that officer was right.
I know.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. I'm taking my sister's advice. I'm just hoping it works this time.
What? Which officer? The one who shops for me? I told you not to listen to him! Though, that was mostly because I was afraid he'd tell you what I just told you...
You... you know? What kind of thing is that to say in reply to a confession of love?
So... how do you feel, Capitano? Do you feel the same way? Different? Do you even know? I need an answer!
Well... I was hoping to have something to give you at this moment, but you really are a hard woman to shop for.
What does that have to do with anything? I tell you I love you and you tell me I'm difficult to shop for? Is that supposed to be a weird form of rejection? Or are you-
I feel the same way, Cesare!
You... you feel the same way? You mean you agree it's a weird reply? Or do you...
I love you, too.
You do? Really? I don't know what to say...
You don't need to say anything. Just come here.
Okay. I'm here, with you.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
What are you doing out here, Cesare?
Nothing. I was just feeling happy, and felt like just jotting some things down. I was actually going to finish this and then work on finding my talent some more. Would you like to help?
Sure, I'd love to, but what are you jotting down?
I don't know. Just words. I like to make them rhyme.
Cesare, I think... I think that's poetry you're writing.
Hey, did I say you could read over my shoulder like that?
Maybe I just like being close to you. Plus, I get to read some pretty good poetry. How long have you been doing this?
Always? It's just something I do when I feel like it.

Fields.MenuText: You are adorable, but you're a little oblivious, you know that?
So why have you been running around everywhere looking for a talent?
And you've always been this good? Sounds like a talent to me.

Fields.DialogueText: You think I'm adorable? Wait, you also called me oblivious. I don't want you to think I missed that.
What does that have to do with anything?
A talent? You're messing with me, right?
Cesare, being able to write stuff like this without even trying is a talent.
What are you talking about? Everyone can write. Wait, are you illiterate, Capitano?
There's a difference between writing words and writing feelings. From what I've read over your shoulder, you might have a serious knack for writing poetry.
I'm writing poetry? I always thought poetry was harder.
For some people it is, but for others it just comes naturally.
So I have a talent? I have a talent! I'm talented! I can't wait to tell Cavour!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Cesare, I've got a surprise for you.
A surprise? I hope it's not a present. You don't have to get me anything. I'm just happy to... have you... Oh, and our matching necklaces.
Well, it's a little tough to explain. Just take a walk on the deck with me.
Oh, Capitano! How'd you know I wanted to see Mount Fuji?!

Fields.MenuText: I know a lot of things.
I asked around. You're not the only one who knows how to ask questions.
You told me, of course.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's good. Because I have a lot of questions.
Maybe not, but I am the best, right? You don't think you're actually better than I am, do you?
I did? When did I tell you that? Since when did I become so forgetful?
I was thinking we could have a nice date with Mount Fuji in the background. A little picnic or something.
That sounds... like a dream. We should definitely do that.
Great, I'll go get some food. Can you go and grab a blanket or something for us to sit on?
Uhhh... I would... but I don't want to miss anything.
Miss anything?
Mount Fuji. It's a volcano. What if I go grab a blanket, and that's when it chooses to erupt?!
That's why you wanted to see it before we left?
I've always wanted to see a volcano spew out lava! Haven't you, Capitano?
Not nearly as much. Tell you what, I'll go grab everything. You just stay here and keep an eye out for an eruption. Oh, and Morganas.
Oh, yeah. Obviously I'll keep on the lookout for Morganas.
*ALARM*
That's not my fault! They came out of nowhere, right?
*sigh*
@BATTLE
Shall we get back to our date?
I'll be with you as soon as I've put out the fires, I promise!
